required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Artificial Shrinkage of Blastocyst Before Invitro Fertilization
clinical_study.official_title: Artificial Shrinkage of Blastocyst Before Invitro Fertilization

brief_summary.textblock: Vitrification is a modern cryopreservation technique based on sudden cooling of reproductive cells to a temperature of -196 ° C in seconds that produces glass-like solidification of a solution without crystallization, but by extreme elevation in viscosity during freezing

detailed_description.textblock: Vitrification is a modern cryopreservation technique based on sudden cooling of reproductive cells to a temperature of -196 ° C in seconds that produces glass-like solidification of a solution without crystallization, but by extreme elevation in viscosity during freezing Unlike the slow freezing method, vitrification has better results in a complete elimination of ice crystal inside the cells as well as in the surrounding solution -Also, it has a significantly higher post-thawing survival rate in comparison to slow freezing method

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: effect of using LASER pulse versus micro-needle use in the artificial shrinkage of blastocysts .
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The number of women who will have positive pregnancy test
primary_outcome.description: The number of women who will come pregnant afterveach technique

arm_group.description: effect of using LASER pulse versus micro-needle use in the artificial shrinkage of blastocysts as a previous step before vitrification in regarding their effect on embryo viability
effect of using LASER pulse versus micro-needle use in the artificial shrinkage of blastocysts as a previous step before vitrification in regarding their effect on embryo viability

intervention.description: Using micro needle technique before ICSI

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- women with infertility from 20 to 42 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- women with age more than 42 or less than 20
